resources:
TourGuide - Rybnik
Basilic of St. Anthony The neo-gothic basilic TODO:dokończyć ul. Mikolowska 4, Rybnik
Fountain Every evening music and light show pl. Jana Pawla II, Rybnik
Kapielisko Ruda Sport and Recreation Center ul. Gliwicka 72, Rybnik
Old Market Historical market square in central Rybnik ul. Rynek, Rybnik
Theme Park Park with many facilities for children ul. Rudzka, Rybnik
St. Wawrzyniec Church Wooden Church from XVIII century ul. Wolna 125, Rybnik
Ignacy Historic Mine Museum of mining in Rybnik ul. Ignacego Moscickiego 3, Rybnik
Town Hall Neo-classical old town hall with clock-tower, housing the registry office and the museum of local history Rynek 18, Rybnik
Academic Church The Oldest and the smallest church in Rybnik. ul. Gliwica, Rybnik
Castle in Rybnik Old Piasts castle in the central Rybnik. Today\'s court. Plac Kopernika 2, Rybnik
Symbols of Rybnik
Flag Flag of Rybnik represents 3 lines in blue and white color, with coat of arms in the middle
Coat of Arms Pike in the middle with water nuts in 2 corners
Anthem Since 2003 you can hear Rybnik\'s anthem every hour at Main Square. It was composted by M.Blaszczyka for VIII century anniversary of Rybnik

History
History of Rybnik
The city first developed as a fishing center(Rybnik means fishpond in Slaciv languages) in medival ages, then was a capital of so-called Rybnik State. Rybnik grew as an important centr of coal mining and the seat of the surrounding county in the 19th century. Rybnik has a population of about 140 000. City area with large coal mines and power plants is an important economic region of Poland. and a visible center of music, home of Szafrankowie Brother State School of Music as well as a Philharmonic Orchestra.
